snippet: The case of Julian Assange, the Wikileaks founder stranded in London despite a grant of asylum in Ecuador, has rekindled suspicions in Latin America about perceived neo-colonialism on the part of the British.
abstract: The case of Julian Assange, the Wikileaks founder stranded in London despite a grant of asylum in Ecuador, has rekindled suspicions in Latin America about perceived neo-colonialism on the part of the British.

headline.main: Latin America Sees Hand of Colonialism in Assange Standoff
